datafield.subfield: Physician and educator; administrator with the World Health Organization; secretary-general with Pan American Health Organization of the World Health Organization, 1957-1960; dean of the School of Public Health and professor of pediatrics and communicable diseases in the Medical School of the University of Michigan, 1960-1974.

Collection arranged into seven series: 1) Biographical and early materials, 1939-2004; 2) University of Michigan, 1959-1990, consisting of committee files, curriculum development materials, and records pertaining to his study of a possible Health Maintenance Organization for the University of Michigan; 3) Comprehensive health planning organizations, 1968-1980, details Wegman's involvement with the Areawide Health Operating Committee, 1969-1970, the Comprehensive Health Planning Council of Southeastern Michigan, 1971-1980, and Community Health Incorporated, 1968-1973; 4) Associations, Committees, and Projects, 1949-1991, documenting Wegman's work with the World Health Organization, including travel diaries from his work abroad, and his work with the Commission on Reduction of Excess Hospital Capacity, 1977-1980, the Governor's Action Committee on Health Care, 1964-1966, Project HEADSTART, and a Seminar on the Rational Uses of Medicine, 1974-1978; 5) Post-retirement, 1974-1993, documents various activities and travels and his continuing interest in the World Health Organization and the affairs of the University of Michigan; 6) Reprints of writings, 1930-1989; 7) Topical files consist of various materials from Wegman's post-retirement activities and research interests.
Finding aid available via World Wide Web at URL: http://quod.lib.umich.edu/cgi/f/findaid/findaid-idx?c=bhlead&idno=umich-bhl-89211
Commission on Reduction of Excess Hospital Capacity in Southeastern Michigan.
Comprehensive Health Planning Council of Southeastern Michigan.
Governor's Action Committee on Health Care.
